intro: Ambrosia × helenae, commonly known as the giant ragweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and yellow-green flowers that appear in late summer. The plant is known for producing copious amounts of pollen, which can contribute to seasonal allergies. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in agricultural fields. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it a common weed in many regions.
